main event: A light blue object, similar to a 2nd magnitude star, was observed descending rapidly before disappearing below the horizon to the south.
interesting points: The observation lasted about 10-15 seconds., The object appeared blue and was compared to a star., The object's descent was rapid but slower than a meteor., It could have been a slow-moving meteor at 15,000 ft., The report includes various possible conclusions about the object's nature, including balloon or aircraft.
sighted object: light blue object in the sky
location: Between Wake Island & Hickman AFB, Hawaii, USA
witness description: Major William J. Walsh, a reliable observer from McChord AFB, Washington.
